abstract.text: An asset that represents media at a local or remote URL.

inlineContent.text: This class is a concrete subclass of
. When you create an asset as shown below, the system creates and returns an instance of

code: // A local or remote asset URL.

inlineContent.text: In many cases, this is an appropriate way to create asset instances, but you can also directly instantiate an
when you need more fine-grained control over its initialization. The initializer for

accepts an options dictionary, which you use to customize the asset’s initialization for your particular purpose. For example, if you’re creating an asset for an HLS stream, you may want to prevent it from retrieving its media when it connects over a cellular network. You can do this by providing the initialization option and value as shown below.

code: let url: URL = // A remote asset URL.
let asset = AVURLAsset(url: url, options: options)

abstract.text: Work with audiovisual assets, control device cameras, process audio, and configure system audio interactions.
An object that models timed audiovisual media.
An object that models a track of media that an asset contains.
A group of related tracks in an asset.
An object that represents a time range segment of an asset track.
A protocol that defines the interface to load media data asynchronously.
A protocol for requiring decryption keys for media data.
An asset with a duration that the system can extend without modifying its existing media data.
An object that describes a Media Extension.
The tracks an asset contains.
An array of variants that an asset contains.
An asset that represents media at a local or remote URL.
Returns an asset that models the media resource found at the specified URL.
The asset’s associated asset cache, if it exists.
Returns an array of the MIME types the asset supports.
Returns an array of the file types the asset supports.
Returns an asset track from which you can insert any time range into a given composition track.
Loads an asset track from which you can insert any time range into the composition track.
A session identifier that the asset sends in HTTP requests that it makes.
Creates an asset that models the media at the specified URL.
Creates an asset that models the media resource at the specified URL.
Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the asset is playable with the specified codecs and container type.
A Boolean value that indicates whether you can add this asset as a content key recipient to a content key session.
The properties of the media extension format reader that decodes the asset.
The resource loader for the asset.
A URL to the asset’s media.
An array of variants that an asset contains.
Specify options to configure the initialization of a media asset.
A protocol that objects adopt to provide functional copies of themselves.
The protocol for implementing a class to allow an item provider to create an instance of the class.
The protocol for implementing a class to allow an item provider to retrieve data from an instance of the class.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A type whose values can be implicitly or explicitly copied.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
